author: Ahmed360

text: Ok so Id like to clarify myself, I know good games are still being made but the majority suck. I do still buy games but it sucks that most games focus on multiplayer or are fps. I'm currently playing Ni No Kuni which I'm loving so far and plan on getting second son and watch dogs. As for final fantasy, Im sorry I just could not get into 12 or 13 at all. The new one they revealed looks more action adventure than rpg.
author: PRChingon

text: a lot of games are just as good these days as much as they were ages ago, while some old ips have gotten stale others have got better as well as new ips having emerged. It's worth noting that bravely default has taken over the line of old school final fantasy so if that's what you're into definitely check that game out. The real problem with the industry these days are the cheap marketing ploys where a lot of developers care too much more about their money than their consumers. It's great to see big name developers leave their companies in order to pursue gaming as how they see it should be done.

text:
I want to disagree with you. I mean, yes FinalFantasy lost quality so hard, but as for me they still are fungames to play.
And on a second thought, enough good games are actually made. There is just such an overflow with games in general, that of course much more trash games are made as well (as in the past). And as long as it is so easy to gain money with shitty-games the situation will stay. So in the end....yeah we still might have a problem.

author: Great Singaporean

text: And so Igarashi has left Konami. I'm glad he did, Konami barely gave him any work since he released the awesome Order of Ecclesia, his last Metroidvania. I can't help but feel sad knowing that we'll never get a Castlevania game from him again, but I'm very excited for his eventual Kickstarter projects. It's the exact same thing as Inafune leaving Capcom and never making Mega Man games again, but instead doing what he believes in and is passionate about. Good for both of them, and for us gamers.
author: SupraDarky

text: I also feel sad about this.  Even though I have not played a Castlevania game yet.  Anyways, i love the soundtrack for SOTN.  It is my favorite of the Yamane's soundtracks, which is something else that I miss from the latest Castlevania games.  The soundtracks she did when she worked for Konami are absolutely awesome.
